intro: Ptilotus alexandri, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to red. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its leaves are usually small and fleshy, helping to conserve water, while its flowers bloom in late summer or early autumn. Ptilotus alexandri is often found in coastal dunes and inland deserts, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
